title: Maurizio Sarri leaves Cristiano Ronaldo out of his squad for Lecce clash to give striker a rest
text:
Juventus boss Maurizio Sarri has revealed he's left Cristiano Ronaldo out of his squad to face Lecce in order to give him a much needed rest.

Ronaldo has started all but one of Juventus' games so far this season and scored five goals in 10 games in all competitions but will be missing on Saturday.

Sarri was quick to dispel suggestions that Ronaldo had been dropped for the clash and said it was an opportunity for him to recharge his batteries.

Juventus boss Maurizio Sarri has left Cristiano Ronaldo out of his squad to face Lecce

Sarri says Ronaldo needs a rest after starting all but one of the club's opening 10 games

Ronaldo has scored give goals in 10 appearances for Juventus in all competitions this season

'With Cristiano, we speak often,' he said at his pre-match news conference.

'Even for him there will be need for rest. We'll see based on how he's feeling. I don't know when, we will decide.

'Right now we don't have a lot of options in order to completely rotate the squad. We'll change things with regards to the conditions of the players.'

Sarri says he's also keen to rest defender Leonard Bonucci but can't afford to do without him

Sarri is also keen to rest centre-back Leonardo Bonucci, but the veteran will feature from the start against Lecce.

'Leonardo Bonucci has played a lot this season and he's needed to. We'll see if we can give him a rest over the next few games,' he added.

Juve have made a fine start to the season in Serie A, winning seven of their opening eight games, which leaves them top of the table, one point ahead of Inter Milan.

The Bianconeri are also joint top of Champions League Group D, with seven points from three games.
description: Juventus boss Maurizio Sarri has revealed he's left Cristiano Ronaldo out of his squad to face Lecce in order to give him a rest after the forward started all but one of the club's opening 10 games.
